ISSUE.TITLE: unable to install now
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: I am unable to install now via npm on my system (Windows 10 Pro 64bit) for a work project, not sure how to proceed. I have provided a snippet below. Latest versions of node and npm installed. Any help is greatly appreciated. Thank you. ``` UNC paths are not supported. Defaulting to Windows directory. module.js:471 throw err; ^ Error: Cannot find module 'C:\Windows\download\install.js' at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:469:15) at Function.Module._load (module.js:417:25) at Module.runMain (module.js:604:10) at run (bootstrap_node.js:389:7) at startup (bootstrap_node.js:149:9) at bootstrap_node.js:502:3 npm ERR! Windows_NT 10.0.15063 npm ERR! argv "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "install" "-g" "now" npm ERR! node v6.11.3 npm ERR! npm v3.10.10 npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE npm ERR! now@8.3.4 postinstall: `node download/install.js` npm ERR! Exit status 1 npm ERR! npm ERR! Failed at the now@8.3.4 postinstall script 'node download/install.js'. npm ERR! Make sure you have the latest version of node.js and npm installed.` ``` No debug log was created. Any advice? Thanks.
